items.title: [Feature Request]: structured list alignments
items.body:
### Package

@carbon/react

### Browser

Chrome, Safari, Firefox

### Package version

v11

### Description

- The structured list component should only offer the `flush` alignment for the `simple` variant. The states for the selectable variant with flush alignment start to get tricky visually. We need to update structured list to only support the flush alignment for the simple variant.

---

### Structured list
This is an outline of what the modifiers should be per variant:
- **Simple variant**
  - Hang alignment
    - Default size
    - Condensed size
  - Flush alignment
    - Default size
    - Condensed size
- **Selectable variant**
   - Hang alignment
      - Default size
      - Condensed size

### Screenshots

 In the newest React storybook, I do not see the props anymore.

### Steps to reproduce

Currently I do not see the props in React for the different alignments, so those should be added in.

items.title: [Bug]: Unordered list item markers extend beyond list bounds
items.body:
### Package

carbon-components

### Browser

Chrome

### Package version

v10.47.1

### Description

The top level elements of an unordered list have `–` markers that end up outside the bounding box of the list.

The marker is added via `:before`:
```css
.bx--list--unordered>.bx--list__item:before {
    content: "\002013";
    left: -1rem;
    position: absolute;
}
```

Maybe the list should have some left padding to offset the marker placement?

### Screenshots

From [live demo page](https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/components/list/usage/#live-demo):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/834235/143763760-2181dd2f-e453-4731-bbdd-c874436fce50.png)

### Steps to reproduce

- Create an unordered list component with items in it or go to [live demo page](https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/components/list/usage/#live-demo) and set variant selector to `Unordered list`
- Inspect DOM element layout of list `ul.bx--list--unordered` element

items.title: [doc] List "persistent" prop for DataTable component on Storybook
items.body: ### Summary I found out from the implementation code that the TableToolbarSearch in DataTable can be expanded by adding `persistent` to `TableToolbarSearch` props. So a user won't need to click on the search icon to expand the search bar for typing a term. It will be really useful if this is mentioned in Storybook. I like that there is a prop for keeping the search bar expanded. Very useful!

items.title: ComboBox doesn't support entry of Text not found in list items
items.body:
## ComboBox has onInputChange but no way to know when Enter is pressed ##

Though documentation claims the ComboBox allows people to enter text not found in the list items, there is no notification that this has occurred. There should be an onSubmit method to allow capture of Text that was in the input field when enter was pressed. If text matches a list item, that becomes selected and onChange is fired.

## What package(s) are you using?
- [x] carbon-components-react-7.18.0.tgz
- [x] carbon-components-10.18.0.tgz

## Detailed description

> I can not determine if the user has pressed enter in the ComboBox input to get its value for the ID I'd used to identify the ComboBox if what the user typed is not in the list.

> Is this issue related to a specific component? Yes, ComboBox

> What did you expect to happen? What happened instead? What would you like to
> see changed? I would like an onSubmit or onChange to report an event with the text containing the value of the ComboBox when the user has pressed enter for anything they typed, not just for matching items in the list.

> What browser are you working in? Fails in Chrome and Firefox

> What version of the Carbon Design System are you using? 10.18.0 for carbon-components

items.title: A11y no hover for uncompleted strings in Dropdown and OverflowMenu list
items.body: Hi, I work on Key Protect UI team, and we've been having issues with Dropdown and OverflowMenu hover text not appearing on focused list items when using keyboard controls. I'm not well-versed in accessibility, so let me know if you need any clarifications on this - it was brought up to us by global shared services team. ## Environment > Operating system Mac OS 10.14.6 > Browser Google Chrome 84.0.4147.105 > Automated testing tool and ruleset https://www.ibm.com/able/guidelines/ci162/content_on_hover_71.html > Assistive technology used to verify Using tabs and arrow keys ## Detailed description > What version of the Carbon Design System are you using? "carbon-components": "10.16.0", "carbon-components-react": "7.16.0", > What did you expect to happen? I can see the hover text message when I use mouse over these list items. I would expect this hover text to appear when I use keyboard controls to focus these list items. > What happened instead? No hover text appears when I used arrow keys to focus these list items. > What WCAG 2.1 checkpoint does the issue violate? https://www.ibm.com/able/guidelines/ci162/content_on_hover_71.html ## Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Use tab and enter or space to navigate to a Dropdown or OverflowMenu and open it. 2. Use arrow keys to focus a list item This is present in the Carbon docs for these components too. https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/components/dropdown/code/ https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/components/overflow-menu/code
